parameters.description: The ID of the conversation to add the item to.
parameters.name: conversation_id

parameters.description:
Additional fields to include in the response. See the `include`
parameter for [listing Conversation items above](/docs/api-reference/conversations/list-items#conversations_list_items-include) for more information.
parameters.name: include

items.description: The items to add to the conversation. You may add up to 20 items at a time.

summary: Create items in a conversation with the given ID.

IncludeEnum.description:
Specify additional output data to include in the model response. Currently supported values are:
- `web_search_call.action.sources`: Include the sources of the web search tool call.
- `code_interpreter_call.outputs`: Includes the outputs of python code execution in code interpreter tool call items.
- `computer_call_output.output.image_url`: Include image urls from the computer call output.
- `file_search_call.results`: Include the search results of the file search tool call.
- `message.input_image.image_url`: Include image urls from the input message.
- `message.output_text.logprobs`: Include logprobs with assistant messages.
- `reasoning.encrypted_content`: Includes an encrypted version of reasoning tokens in reasoning item outputs. This enables reasoning items to be used in multi-turn conversations when using the Responses API statelessly (like when the `store` parameter is set to `false`, or when an organization is enrolled in the zero data retention program).

oneOf.description:
An item representing part of the context for the response to be
generated by the model. Can contain text, images, and audio inputs,
as well as previous assistant responses and tool call outputs.
oneOf.title: Item

first_id.description: The ID of the first item in the list.

has_more.description: Whether there are more items available.

last_id.description: The ID of the last item in the list.

object.description: The type of object returned, must be `list`.

EasyInputMessage.description:
A message input to the model with a role indicating instruction following
hierarchy. Instructions given with the `developer` or `system` role take
precedence over instructions given with the `user` role. Messages with the
`assistant` role are presumed to have been generated by the model in previous
interactions.

content.description:
Text, image, or audio input to the model, used to generate a response.
Can also contain previous assistant responses.

oneOf.description: A text input to the model.
oneOf.title: Text input

role.description:
The role of the message input. One of `user`, `assistant`, `system`, or
`developer`.

type.description: The type of the message input. Always `message`.

EasyInputMessage.title: Input message

Item.description: Content item used to generate a response.

ItemReferenceParam.description: An internal identifier for an item to reference.

id.description: The ID of the item to reference.

anyOf.description: The type of item to reference. Always `item_reference`.

ItemReferenceParam.title: Item reference

ConversationItem.description: A single item within a conversation. The set of possible types are the same as the `output` type of a [Response object](/docs/api-reference/responses/object#responses/object-output).
ConversationItem.title: Conversation item

InputMessageContentList.description:
A list of one or many input items to the model, containing different content 
types.
InputMessageContentList.title: Input item content list

MessagePhase.description:
Labels an `assistant` message as intermediate commentary (`commentary`) or the final answer (`final_answer`). For models like `gpt-5.3-codex` and beyond, when sending follow-up requests, preserve and resend phase on all assistant messages â€” dropping it can degrade performance. Not used for user messages.

Use `commentary` for an intermediate assistant message and `final_answer` for
the final assistant message. For follow-up requests with models like
`gpt-5.3-codex` and later, preserve and resend phase on all assistant
messages. Omitting it can degrade performance. Not used for user messages.

InputMessage.description:
A message input to the model with a role indicating instruction following
hierarchy. Instructions given with the `developer` or `system` role take
precedence over instructions given with the `user` role.

role.description: The role of the message input. One of `user`, `system`, or `developer`.

status.description:
The status of item. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, or
`incomplete`. Populated when items are returned via API.

type.description: The type of the message input. Always set to `message`.

InputMessage.title: Input message

OutputMessage.description: An output message from the model.

content.description: The content of the output message.

id.description: The unique ID of the output message.

role.description: The role of the output message. Always `assistant`.

status.description:
The status of the message input. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, or
`incomplete`. Populated when input items are returned via API.

type.description: The type of the output message. Always `message`.

OutputMessage.title: Output message

FileSearchToolCall.description:
The results of a file search tool call. See the
[file search guide](/docs/guides/tools-file-search) for more information.

id.description: The unique ID of the file search tool call.

queries.description: The queries used to search for files.

anyOf.description: The results of the file search tool call.

file_id.description: The unique ID of the file.

score.description: The relevance score of the file - a value between 0 and 1.

text.description: The text that was retrieved from the file.

status.description:
The status of the file search tool call. One of `in_progress`,
`searching`, `incomplete` or `failed`,

type.description: The type of the file search tool call. Always `file_search_call`.

FileSearchToolCall.title: File search tool call

ComputerToolCall.description:
A tool call to a computer use tool. See the
[computer use guide](/docs/guides/tools-computer-use) for more information.

call_id.description: An identifier used when responding to the tool call with output.

id.description: The unique ID of the computer call.

pending_safety_checks.description: The pending safety checks for the computer call.

status.description:
The status of the item. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, or
`incomplete`. Populated when items are returned via API.

type.description: The type of the computer call. Always `computer_call`.

ComputerToolCall.title: Computer tool call

ComputerCallOutputItemParam.description: The output of a computer tool call.

anyOf.description: The safety checks reported by the API that have been acknowledged by the developer.

call_id.description: The ID of the computer tool call that produced the output.

anyOf.description: The ID of the computer tool call output.
The status of the message input. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, or `incomplete`. Populated when input items are returned via API.

type.description: The type of the computer tool call output. Always `computer_call_output`.

ComputerCallOutputItemParam.title: Computer tool call output

WebSearchToolCall.description:
The results of a web search tool call. See the
[web search guide](/docs/guides/tools-web-search) for more information.

action.description:
An object describing the specific action taken in this web search call.
Includes details on how the model used the web (search, open_page, find_in_page).

id.description: The unique ID of the web search tool call.

status.description: The status of the web search tool call.

type.description: The type of the web search tool call. Always `web_search_call`.

WebSearchToolCall.title: Web search tool call

FunctionToolCall.description:
A tool call to run a function. See the 
[function calling guide](/docs/guides/function-calling) for more information.

arguments.description: A JSON string of the arguments to pass to the function.

call_id.description: The unique ID of the function tool call generated by the model.

id.description: The unique ID of the function tool call.

name.description: The name of the function to run.

status.description:
The status of the item. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, or
`incomplete`. Populated when items are returned via API.

type.description: The type of the function tool call. Always `function_call`.

FunctionToolCall.title: Function tool call

FunctionCallOutputItemParam.description: The output of a function tool call.

call_id.description: The unique ID of the function tool call generated by the model.

anyOf.description: The unique ID of the function tool call output. Populated when this item is returned via API.

output.description: Text, image, or file output of the function tool call.

oneOf.description: A JSON string of the output of the function tool call.
An array of content outputs (text, image, file) for the function tool call.

items.description: A piece of message content, such as text, an image, or a file.

anyOf.description: The status of the item. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, or `incomplete`. Populated when items are returned via API.

type.description: The type of the function tool call output. Always `function_call_output`.

FunctionCallOutputItemParam.title: Function tool call output

ReasoningItem.description:
A description of the chain of thought used by a reasoning model while generating
a response. Be sure to include these items in your `input` to the Responses API
for subsequent turns of a conversation if you are manually
[managing context](/docs/guides/conversation-state).

anyOf.description:
The encrypted content of the reasoning item - populated when a response is
generated with `reasoning.encrypted_content` in the `include` parameter.

id.description: The unique identifier of the reasoning content.

status.description:
The status of the item. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, or
`incomplete`. Populated when items are returned via API.

type.description: The type of the object. Always `reasoning`.

ReasoningItem.title: Reasoning

CompactionSummaryItemParam.description: A compaction item generated by the [`v1/responses/compact` API](/docs/api-reference/responses/compact).

encrypted_content.description: The encrypted content of the compaction summary.

anyOf.description: The ID of the compaction item.

type.description: The type of the item. Always `compaction`.

CompactionSummaryItemParam.title: Compaction item

anyOf.description:
Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be
useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured
format, and querying for objects via API or the dashboard. Keys are strings
with a maximum length of 64 characters. Values are strings with a maximum
length of 512 characters, booleans, or numbers.

always set to `computer_screenshot`.

ComputerToolCallOutput.title: Computer tool call output

items.description: A list of commands to run.

anyOf.description: Optional maximum number of characters to return from each command.
Optional timeout in milliseconds for the commands.

LocalEnvironmentResource.description: Represents the use of a local environment to perform shell actions.

type.description: The environment type. Always `local`.

LocalEnvironmentResource.title: Local Environment

type.description: The environment type. Always `container_reference`.

FunctionShellCallOutputContent.description: The content of a shell tool call output that was emitted.

created_by.description: The identifier of the actor that created the item.

outcome.description: Represents either an exit outcome (with an exit code) or a timeout outcome for a shell call output chunk.
outcome.title: Shell call outcome

stderr.description: The standard error output that was captured.

stdout.description: The standard output that was captured.

FunctionShellCallOutputContent.title: Shell call output content

ApplyPatchCreateFileOperation.description: Instruction describing how to create a file via the apply_patch tool.

path.description: Path of the file to create.

type.description: Create a new file with the provided diff.

ApplyPatchCreateFileOperation.title: Apply patch create file operation

ApplyPatchDeleteFileOperation.description: Instruction describing how to delete a file via the apply_patch tool.

path.description: Path of the file to delete.

type.description: Delete the specified file.

ApplyPatchDeleteFileOperation.title: Apply patch delete file operation

ApplyPatchUpdateFileOperation.description: Instruction describing how to update a file via the apply_patch tool.

path.description: Path of the file to update.

type.description: Update an existing file with the provided diff.

ApplyPatchUpdateFileOperation.title: Apply patch update file operation

button.description: Indicates which mouse button was pressed during the click. One of `left`, `right`, `wheel`, `back`, or `forward`.

type.description: Specifies the event type. For a click action, this property is always `click`.

x.description: The x-coordinate where the click occurred.

y.description: The y-coordinate where the click occurred.

type.description: Specifies the event type. For a double click action, this property is always set to `double_click`.

x.description: The x-coordinate where the double click occurred.

y.description: The y-coordinate where the double click occurred.

path.description:
An array of coordinates representing the path of the drag action. Coordinates will appear as an array of objects, eg
```
[
  { x: 100, y: 200 },
  { x: 200, y: 300 }
]
```

type.description: Specifies the event type. For a drag action, this property is always set to `drag`.

KeyPressAction.description: A collection of keypresses the model would like to perform.

keys.description: The combination of keys the model is requesting to be pressed. This is an array of strings, each representing a key.

items.description: One of the keys the model is requesting to be pressed.

type.description: Specifies the event type. For a keypress action, this property is always set to `keypress`.

KeyPressAction.title: KeyPress

type.description: Specifies the event type. For a move action, this property is always set to `move`.
Specifies the event type. For a screenshot action, this property is always set to `screenshot`.
Specifies the event type. For a scroll action, this property is always set to `scroll`.

x.description: The x-coordinate where the scroll occurred.

y.description: The y-coordinate where the scroll occurred.

TypeParam.description: An action to type in text.

type.description: Specifies the event type. For a type action, this property is always set to `type`.

TypeParam.title: Type

type.description: Specifies the event type. For a wait action, this property is always set to `wait`.

path.description: The path to the directory containing the skill.

FunctionShellCallOutputOutcomeParam.description: The exit or timeout outcome associated with this shell call.
FunctionShellCallOutputOutcomeParam.title: Shell call outcome

ApplyPatchCreateFileOperationParam.description: Instruction for creating a new file via the apply_patch tool.

diff.description: Unified diff content to apply when creating the file.

path.description: Path of the file to create relative to the workspace root.

type.description: The operation type. Always `create_file`.

ApplyPatchCreateFileOperationParam.title: Apply patch create file operation

ApplyPatchDeleteFileOperationParam.description: Instruction for deleting an existing file via the apply_patch tool.

path.description: Path of the file to delete relative to the workspace root.

type.description: The operation type. Always `delete_file`.

ApplyPatchUpdateFileOperationParam.description: Instruction for updating an existing file via the apply_patch tool.

diff.description: Unified diff content to apply to the existing file.

path.description: Path of the file to update relative to the workspace root.

type.description: The operation type. Always `update_file`.

ApplyPatchUpdateFileOperationParam.title: Apply patch update file operation

Annotation.description: An annotation that applies to a span of output text.

type.description: The outcome type. Always `timeout`.

exit_code.description: Exit code from the shell process.

type.description: The outcome type. Always `exit`.

filename.description: The filename of the file cited.

index.description: The index of the file in the list of files.
